thread.title: Holganzas split Petron Blaze top honors
thread.title_full: Holganzas split Petron Blaze top honors

title: Holganzas split Petron Blaze top honors
text:
Holganzas split Petron Blaze top honors   Brothers Rhett and Jericke Don Holganza celebrate after ruling the Petron Blaze 100 X30 Challenge. 
MANILA, Philippines - Cebuano brothers Jericke Don and Rhett Holganza shared top honors and powered Praga Racing Team to victory in the two-race kickoff of the Petron Blaze 100 X30 Challenge Philippines at the Carmona Race Track in Cavite recently. 
The Holganzas bucked the challenge of their veteran American, Chinese and Japanese rivals in the 10-man grid of the X30 Masters Blaze 100 class with Jericke Don topping Race 1 of the X30 Masters Blaze 100 by 10.628 seconds over Chinese Sky Zhu. Japanese Takehiko Kuchikata wound up third. 
Rhett Holganza, on the other hand, bounced back strong from a mishap that forced his early exit in Race 1, turning in a solid finish to emerge the X30 Masters Blaze 100 champion in Race 2, just 0.681 of a second over Jericke that likewise sealed a 1-2 finish for the Praga Racing Team. 
Michael Jordan rallied to finish third while Zhu and Kuchikata placed fourth and fifth, respectively. 
Starting unusually slow in Race 1, the Holganzas had to double up their effort to secure a 1-2 pole position in the final race.
